title: Kader Siddique says his party will join polls only if it’s ‘inclusive’
body: Krishak Sramik Janata League President Bangabir Abdul Kader Siddique today said his party would join the upcoming national election if it is inclusive. "We, the 'Gamcha (symbol) Party', will join the election if it is held with the participation of all. We will not take part if the majority of the country's people are left out of the election," he said. Kader Siddique was speaking at a rally organised by Krishak Sramik Janata League at Shaheed Smriti Municipal Park in Tangail district town today. He also claimed that fewer than 20 percent voters may go to the polling stations, if the election is held in participation with only BNP, Jamaat and NCP. Kader Siddique's elder brother, former minister Abdul Latif Siddique, also spoke at the rally.
